repo.description: Powerful Tox chat client that follows the Tox design guidelines.
repo.name: qTox

body: This is just for local compilation so we don't need to keep deleting `_build` and can instead build both in the same source directory. Also removed some unused code for wine dll prefixes. Needs https://github.com/TokTok/dockerfiles/pull/184 - - - This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/TokTok/qTox/228)

comment_data.body:
Again, the i386 path is not correct, should be `/usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/wine/i386-windows`.

The x86_64 one is correct.

Done.
<!-- Reviewable comment -ODrYXIC5nlWSMlCcrFw:b-896fix -->
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

Done.
<!-- Reviewable comment -ODrYXUh8K3JvJvasBGN:b-896fix -->
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

comment_regular_data.body:
*[`windows/cross-compile/build.sh` line 214 at r1](https://reviewable.io/reviews/TokTok/qTox/228#-ODqn87l415fx-BVX0z3:-ODr809CDJouQevuDpcD:b-r51s9c) ([raw file](https://github.com/TokTok/qTox/blob/46c299924a139ecfdcfbb30d7626fde0252dd4da/windows/cross-compile/build.sh#L214)):*
Previously, nurupo wrote…
Ok, I think I know why, this line should actually be: ```diff -if grep -q 'not found' dlls-required | grep -q -v 'api-ms-win-'; then +if grep 'not found' dlls-required | grep -q -v 'api-ms-win-'; then ``` because as it is now, the second grep receives no input text to process and always returns failure, so the if-statement is never entered.
Huh, on a second look, these greps make no sense to me. The behavior we want is: "If a dll is 'not found' and that dll doesn't start with 'api-ms-win-'", but it does something different.

*[`windows/cross-compile/build.sh` line 214 at r1](https://reviewable.io/reviews/TokTok/qTox/228#-ODqn87l415fx-BVX0z3:-ODr9bbO74X8xFwWRfmw:benvx4m) ([raw file](https://github.com/TokTok/qTox/blob/46c299924a139ecfdcfbb30d7626fde0252dd4da/windows/cross-compile/build.sh#L214)):*
Previously, nurupo wrote…
Huh, on a second look, these greps make no sense to me. The behavior we want is: "If a dll is 'not found' and that dll doesn't start with 'api-ms-win-'", but it does something different.
Oh, ignore my last comment. I did some tests and it looks like this should actually work. This if-statement does "Print all lines with 'not found' lines, and if any of them don't contain 'api-ms-win-' -- exit 1".

Added a test commit to print the contents of the required-dlls file, as I want to see what is going on with the dlls. With `WINE_DLL_DIR` being removed, many system dlls, like `user32.dll`, `shell32.dll`, `ole32.dll`, `opengl32.dll`, `msvcrt.dll`, `ws2_32.dll`, etc. should be not found by mingw-ldd.py and the build should fail. Unless Qt6/toxcore/etc link to the system dlls only via their `api-ms-win-*` names?
Ok, so the build does indeed fail as expected. I guess my GitHub PR web page was showing me cached Windows CI builds from the commit before where they succeeded. Removing my test commit then.
Huh? Why does it no longer fail after I removed `cat dlls-required`?

*[`windows/cross-compile/build.sh` line 201 at r1](https://reviewable.io/reviews/TokTok/qTox/228#-ODqmr6-4iAX1VUU-ey_:-ODrGGcYDbiLbebKFWn2:bhltnae) ([raw file](https://github.com/TokTok/qTox/blob/24b3643dcb04ae255a25177765095a8e91760b0c/windows/cross-compile/build.sh#L201)):*
Previously, iphydf wrote…
Those directories don't exist.
They do exist though though? Replicating https://github.com/TokTok/dockerfiles/blob/master/qtox/docker/Dockerfile.windows-builder ```bash $ sudo docker run --rm -it ubuntu:24.04 /bin/bash # dpkg --add-architecture i386 # apt-get install curl gnupg # curl -L --connect-timeout 10 https://dl.winehq.org/wine-builds/winehq.key | apt-key add - # echo "deb https://dl.winehq.org/wine-builds/ubuntu/ oracular main" >> /etc/apt/sources.list.d/wine.list # apt-get update # apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends winbind wine-stable wine32:i386 wine64 # find / -iname 'shell32.dll' /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/wine/x86_64-windows/shell32.dll /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/wine/i386-windows/shell32.dll ```

commit.message:
chore: Build windows outputs into arch-specific build dirs.

This is just for local compilation so we don't need to keep deleting
`_build` and can instead build both in the same source directory.

Also removed some unused code for wine dll prefixes.
